title: Fix Admin Center Access Control and Hero Section Text Visibility

requirements.summary: Change hero section text 'Our mission is your success' and 'Explore Our Services' to bold white color for visibility against the dark background
acceptanceCriteria: Text 'Our mission is your success' displays in bold white on HomePage
Text 'Explore Our Services' displays in bold white on HomePage
Both text elements are clearly visible against the dark hero background
Font weight is bold (font-weight: 700 or font-bold class)

file_operations.description: Modify the hero section to apply bold white styling to the text 'Our mission is your success' and 'Explore Our Services'. Update the className attributes to include 'font-bold text-white' classes, ensuring both text elements have sufficient contrast against the dark hero background image (frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-business.dim_1200x600.jpg). Remove any existing color classes that may conflict with white text.

requirements.summary: Add solid backgrounds to all popups, dropdown menus, and modal overlays throughout the application to ensure text readability when displayed over other content
acceptanceCriteria: All dropdown menus have solid opaque backgrounds
All modal dialogs have solid opaque backgrounds
All popup overlays have solid backgrounds with no transparency
Text remains readable when overlays appear on top of existing content

file_operations.description: Update the mobile menu Sheet component and role-based dropdown menus (Customer, Sellers/Businesses, Account) to have solid opaque backgrounds. Add bg-white or bg-gray-900 classes with explicit opacity-100 to ensure no transparency. Remove any bg-opacity or backdrop-blur classes that create semi-transparent effects.

Ensure the modal dialog has a solid opaque background by adding bg-white class to the DialogContent component. Remove any transparency or blur effects that may reduce text readability when the modal appears over page content.

Update the DialogContent to have a solid opaque background by applying bg-white class and removing any transparency effects. Ensure the dialog overlay and content have sufficient opacity for text readability.

Ensure the AssistantChatPanel Card component has a solid opaque background by adding bg-white class. Remove any backdrop-blur or transparency classes to maintain text readability when the widget overlay appears on top of page content.

Add a global CSS rule to enforce solid backgrounds on all dropdown menus, popovers, and dialog overlays. Target shadcn/ui component classes like .dropdown-content, .popover-content, and .dialog-content to apply background-color with full opacity. Override any default semi-transparent backgrounds in the component library.

requirements.summary: Review existing admin dashboard code (financial account with transactions, role assignment access control, admin dashboard functionality) and add any vital missing functionality to improve admin operations
acceptanceCriteria: All critical admin features are functional and properly integrated
Admin dashboard displays financial overview correctly
Role assignment and access control management works as expected
Transaction history is accessible and displays properly

file_operations.description: Review the existing admin dashboard implementation and ensure all tabs (Financial Overview, Payment Processors, Revenue Inflow, Fee Configuration, Transactions, Employee Payments, Transfers, User Role Management, Marketplace Roadmap, Access Links, Role Applications) are fully wired and functional. Verify that the access control initialization using useInitializeAccessControl hook is working correctly and displays appropriate error messages when initialization fails. Ensure error states show actionable retry buttons and clear error messages.

Review the financial overview cards displaying available funds, business credit account, and payroll savings. Ensure currency formatting from cents to USD is correct and all data from useGetAdminFinancialState hook is properly displayed. Add loading states and error handling if missing.

Review the transaction history table displaying all transactions via useGetAllTransactionHistory hook. Ensure filtering, currency formatting, date formatting, status badges, and refresh functionality work correctly. Add pagination or virtual scrolling if the transaction list can grow large.

Review the role applications management panel. Ensure the approve/reject actions using useApproveRoleApplication and useRejectRoleApplication mutations work correctly with proper error handling and optimistic updates. Verify that the panel refreshes the pending applications list after actions complete.

Review the user role summary dashboard displaying counts by role (admins, users, guests) via useGetUserRoleSummary hook. Ensure loading and error states are handled properly and the summary updates when roles change.
